shows.title: Natural Remedies / The Practice of Exorcism
shows.first_half: Dr. Randi Shannon discussed the many ways we can use natural remedies to help with ailments. Followed by paranormal investigator Richard Jackson on  exorcisms and related phenomena.

shows.title: Ancient Holiday Traditions / Miracle Open Lines
shows.first_half: First Half: Ordained Anglican Priest Lionel Fanthorpe will regale us with Christmas stories, and he'll also discuss the ancient midwinter feasts observed for millennia before the Christian Christmas. Fanthorpe will include information on Saint Nicholas and the Bishop of Myra in Turkey, who gave gifts to the poor. He'll explain the verses in the song The Twelve Days of Christmas, and treat us to many more holiday traditions and mysteries.
shows.second_half: Second Half: It's Miracle Open Lines! Give George a call on this magical night and talk about a miracle you've experienced.

shows.title: Christmas Miracles / Hidden History
shows.guests: Karen Kingsbury, Cheryll Jones, Frank Jacob
shows.first_half: First Half: Storyteller, filmmaker, and author Karen Kingsbury will discuss miracles and the holiday season. She'll show how at Christmastime we are more aware of miracles because we are more in tune with the sense of wonder that accompanies this magical time of year.
shows.second_half: Second Half: C2C's investigative reporter Cheryll Jones presents her interview with filmmaker and researcher Frank Jacob, who delves into the paranormal and mystical connections between the plasma matrix, electric universe, ancient cultures, hidden history, secret technology, and the 'true' connection to the mysterious 3I/ATLAS.

shows.title: Angelic Healing / Open Lines
shows.first_half: Angel communicator Susan Browne will explain how working with angels and their realms raises one's vibration, transforms limiting patterns, and creates greater wellbeing, clarity, and flow. She'll share stories from her work as a healer and offer simple practices that listeners can use immediately to feel more supported and spiritually connected. Followed by Open Lines—give Ryan a call and discuss whatever's on your mind!

shows.title: Ancient Mysteries / Encounters with Monsters
shows.first_half: Historian David Miano joins Ryan Wrecker (email) to discuss ancient civilizations and how historians and archaeologists investigate them. He'll detail his travels to some of the world's most extraordinary ancient sites and the puzzles and unanswered questions they contain. Followed by director Peter von Puttkamer, who'll share his monster tales, drawn from more than 35 years of global exploration and encounters with fierce wild creatures
shows.second_half: 6-10pm PT: Art Bell - Somewhere in Time returns to 1/30/02 when journalist Eugene Linden shared his view of a future where instability rules the world.

shows.title: UFO Roundtable: 2025 in Review
shows.guests: Andy McGrillen, Jeremy Corbell, Joe Murgia, Danny Silva, Ryan Robbins
shows.first_half: Join George Knapp and his special guests for this end-of-the-year roundtable and UFO wrap-up as they discuss the events that have happened this year, the state of disclosure, and where ufology is headed in 2026 and beyond. In the first half, podcaster Andy McGrillen and filmmaker Jeremy Corbell will discuss the UFO landscape and why it has never been more exciting. Then, in the latter half, researchers Joe Murgia, Danny Silva, and Ryan Robbins will participate in a panel discussion.
